result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett Michael Groer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Garrett Michael Groer in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests to go to plea/sentencing.   Court has colloquy with the defendant. Prosecuting attorney moves to strike repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 & 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court dismisses and reads in count 3.  

Court orders the following: 
Count 1
6 Months Jail  concurrent with Count 2 and consecutive to any other current sentence 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing the 1st of the month following release; alternate 5 days.
- DNA surcharge of $250.00  to be paid per payment plan above; alternative 5 days.
- DNA Sample if not yet provided

Count 2
6 Months Jail  concurrent with Count 1 and consecutive to any other current sentence 
- 30 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 30 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department  append to fine. 
- Fine totaling: $1494.00 to be paid through the payment plan listed in Count 1 ; alternate 30 days jail

From ADA Hirt, advising the Court that the State may request an adjournment of the Jury Trial at the time of Jury Status.  The Court has reviewed the request and it will be addressed at the Jury Status currently scheduled for July 3, 2014.
Filed by the State.
From Dodge Correctional Institution for July 3, 2014 Jury Status Hearing and July 8, 2014 for Jury Trail both at 8:30 am.
